Class RemoteControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • RemoteControl

  • public class RemoteControl
extends java.lang.Object
    The RemoteControl contains the run() method, the method we call to run the program. The program prompts the user to select a .txt file, then using FileResource, another window will open up to display the files the user can choose from. Upon selecting a valid file, the program prints diagnostic information to the console. This includes data about the Kiva's initial location, the status of its boolean fields, and where the Pod and Drop Zones are. The user will be prompted to enter in a series of commands. These commands are taken in as a single string and are then converted into an array of enums that the Kiva can interpret. A success, failure, or error message is displayed after processing the commands.
    Since:
    10-03-2021
    Version:
    0.10
    Author:
    Franz Jacob Hernandez (herfrn@amazon.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RemoteControl

        public RemoteControl()
        Builds a new RemoteControl. The constructor is only called for use in test classes, since the program runs through the run() method call within this class.
        See Also:
        run()

    • Method Detail

      • convertToKivaCommands

        public KivaCommand[] convertToKivaCommands(java.lang.String input)
        Takes in a String from the user and converts the into data the Kiva can interpret. Each char of the given String, if it has an analagous value in KivaCommand, gets turned into an enum of that class and stored in an array. Later, the Kiva will traverse that array and attempt to execute each command. Each value in this array will be read by move()
        Parameters:
        input - The String of commands the user inputted in the console. Should be all uppercase, without whitespace, and only contain char's listed in KivaCommand
        Returns:
        a collection of KivaCommand values for the Kiva to execute
        See Also:
        run(), Kiva.move(KivaCommand)

      • run

        public void run()
        Executes the Kiva program. Prompts the user for the floor map to load, displays the map, and asks the user for commands the Kiva can execute. Calls helper functions to display diagnostic information and to display specific statements at the end of the commands. Has Kiva traverse through an array of KivaCommand in order to perform moves/actions.
        See Also:
        convertToKivaCommands(java.lang.String), displayDiagnostics(Kiva, FloorMap), outputPrintStatement(Kiva, KivaCommand[])
